comments.value:
Hi All
 
Please see below for the project timeline. Let me know if there are any problems.
 
15 April – Kitsite will provide mock up of how new time-lapse will look/work on the website.
 
22 April – Check that everybody is happy with the designs and confirm with Kitsite to go ahead carry out work
 
3/4 May – Kitsite will work to integrate into the website.
 
5/6 May – Testing phase LOCOG ITS/ Site –Eye.
 
6 May (5pm) – Disable all time-lapse function on all cameras from Stamen.
 
9 May – Go live on London 2012.

Hi Uzma,

Attacheed are three mockups, the first two are different routes, the third is the pop-up state.

1a) A text link (obviously this is the simplest / most accessible route)
1b) A hover-over bar at the bottom of the image (will only show when someone hovers over the image, which may mean they won't spot the functionality)

2) The popup, we need to keep the grey background as this is on the actual iframe / flash file supplied by site-eye (I have also attached this for reference)

Let us know if you happy for us to progress with this route and which way of open the pop-up you prefer.

thanks

Jamie

Uzma,

Do you know when we'll be ready to put this live, I'm away from Wednesday so just want to make sure I hand it over to someone here / that they know when it will need to be push to live (as we'll need to do some work re. switching them over)

thanks

Jamie

subject: Video index page

comments.value:
In anticipation of going live with video, we would like to be able to automate the Video index page so we don't have to manually reorder this page every time we add a new video: http://www.london2012.com/videos/

Is there any way of making this automated so that by default it displays the latest video - but we can override the settings if we wish to?

The same applies to the photo index page http://www.london2012.com/photos/

Not critical in terms of priority - but something which would be *really* useful going forwards.

Grateful for your thoughts!

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000
It should be in the (editorial) date order, let me check that a date is being assigned..

I don’t think it’s in any order... at the moment we manually move around all the images.

PS Welcome back!! How was your panel?

Ah yes it is manual, I think we can change it over to be automatic without too much extra effort, will take a look.

Panel went well (I think, well judging buy the tweets it seemed to go well, we got around a hundred tweets about it, using out hash tag)
Yay, great. Hope you get some good follow-up from it. And a contract with Adidas. ☺
Danny, re-assign to me when I get back, but in the off chance Lars has time, this is 1 days work (at least)

Have now switched over Video index to be automated) based on postDate field.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/videos/index.php

Let us know if you want us to migrate photos in the same way (you kind of say yes below, but just double checking before we do it)

comments.value:
Hi all, following up my call to Lars as I said on the phone just now. Appreciate it if you can have a look at these today if at all possible.


1)      On the 'Schedule' pages (which display, correctly, as 'Schedule / Results' it looks like the page heading in the body is still being pulled from the page name in CMS. So it says 'Schedule' in big letters on the page, when it should say 'Schedule / Results' to match the rest of the site. Are you able to fix that?


2)      In Equestrian, there are 4 news stories but only 3 are being pulled through to the News hub, is that odd? There's space for a 4th story but it doesn't seem to get pulled through.



3)      On the News hubs and on a sport's Homepage please can stories now appear latest first? So on the homepage for each sport, if 1 is the newest story they should appear in this order on the page:


1
2

                And on the News hubs they should appear


1                     2

2                     4


4)      How many news stories can be pulled through to a sport's homepage at once? Currently Equestrian is displaying 3 non-featured ones, and is capable of displaying 3 non-featured + 1 featured if we choose to feature one. Can we perhaps limit it so that it displays just the 2 latest  news stories + 1 featured if we choose to feature one?


That all make sense?

Finn Concannon
New Media Producer
LOCOG New Media

comments.value:
Hello there

You are already working on the Travel Advice to Businesses pages for london2012.com to get them live for late November.

There is a second piece of work by M&C Saatchi we are considering for implementing in January - an interactive tool which would walk users through a series of questions and then allow them to download a personalised 'travel plan' based on their responses. An outline of this process is attached, together with wireframes.

We have been told that the interactivity is client side (JavaScript and php). We would wish these pages to be built in the CMS so content can be managed.

What we need from you by Friday morning is a sense of:
Is this achievable in our CMS?
Is there anything M&C are proposing which you don't like or believe to be advisable?
How much time will this take you to implement and what is the cost?
What would you require from M&C Saatchi to smooth this process (more information, coding)?

Grateful for your thoughts.

Many thanks

Morag

subject: Problem with 404 requests to section paths with no filename

comments.value:
This ticket has come from the investigation work on this ticket http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1152

The primary suspect is JS code used in image carousels etc.

Quite a few of direct (ie. no referrer page) references to section paths like this /get-involved/images or get-involved/volunteer/css or /games/venues/js

One suspect here is some JS (for example a image carousel) that loops though images inside a given <div> tag, by appending a filename to a set path ie. "/image/location" + "image1.jpg" if there is no image then the code will try to retrieve the folder alone. 

Obviously where we have written any JS code that has this issue we can fix it. But a lot of the JS on the site was supplied by CogApp / McCann as self contained libraries. Obviously we are trying to gather as much info here as possible as this seems the biggest source of 404's
reassigned to jamie for now
Do we just close this? I'm not going to look at it any time soon :(

subject: Add access control to locksley

comments.value: http://locksley.london2012.com/
might be worth adding ip restrictions in the htaccess file, too

Have added password (using htdigest auth, rather than simple htauth).
Credentials are: locog/st4g1ng
Still to do: implement ip restrictions.
IP restrictions now added. Might need massaging. Currently just allows Clink St, kieran@dublin, and 217.33.164.112 which I think is locog?

Liz says she is indeed 217.33.164.112. I am just checking with Indy at the ODA who has been asking about access to Learning Legacy on staging and Russ at ITS. I have also asked Russ if there is an official list of allowed IPs. Awaiting a response.
Indy at the ODA (also on the 23rd floor at Churchill Place) is 157.203.40.49
Spent another 3 hours getting ModRewrite & .htaccess to play nicely.

These restrictions are kind-of meaningless at the moment, as accessing via:
  http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/
makes all requests appear to be from:
  62.41.8.30
If anyone can bear another round of bridge calls, we really need to work out:
 1. Exactly who (and why) can visit http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com
 2. Exactly who (and why) can visit http://locksley.london2012.com
The current situation is a mess (but all of our previous attempts to rectify it have floundered in bridge-call quagmire).
I suggested to Jamie that we might want to send one of our technical staff (volunteering myself) round to meet their technical staff and threaten to stay there until it gets sorted out.

Let me see if I can make some progress before dragging either of you in again. Could I make sure I understand the situation correctly?

The four sub-domains we are interested in are:

vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com resolving to 2.17.248.29
origin_vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com resolving to 213.120.228.151
locksley.london2012.com resolving to 213.120.228.151
teddy.learninglegacy.london2012.com resolving to 213.120.228.151

I currently have access to all of these from 77.101.147.2. 
(btw pings to origin, locksley and teddy are timing out)

You are also saying that all requests to vip appear to be coming from 62.41.8.30. Can you confirm that this is not the case for the other three sub-domains and that we can restrict by ip address on those and that therefore the only remaining problem is with vip?

(I also need to check whether these are all now visible from clink)
vip is accessible from clink, origin, locksley and teddy are not.
setting to lower priority; happy to re-escalate, just not sure what the plan is at the mo' - also we're waiting for ssl on vip_staging, which is prob enough for everybody to be doing for the moment.

subject: Translation: Today's requests

comments.value:
Hello Patrick,
We don't actually store the job ids in the cms.
We just believe your api.
If you want to renumber them at your end, that's fine. So long as a call to:
"Job/File/completed" will eventually yield us 161 (separate) files, we are
happy.
What you *can't* do is include more than one "page" in each "xml" file that
you return to us.
I hope this is clear.
Kieran

description:
Hello Patrick,
We don't actually store the job ids in the cms.
We just believe your api.
If you want to renumber them at your end, that's fine. So long as a call to:
"Job/File/completed" will eventually yield us 161 (separate) files, we are
happy.
What you *can't* do is include more than one "page" in each "xml" file that
you return to us.
I hope this is clear.
Kieran

subject: Look up table for Nations and Regions

comments.value:
Hello Kate,

It's the "Government Office Region" (GOR) that we use.
(I hadn't realised but - in fact - GOR's were - apparently - phased out last
year!).

I think this is column 18 ("R") in the data.

Anyway, they are listed here:

http://www.ons.gov.uk/search/index.html?newquery=government+office+regions
http://www.ons.gov.uk/about-statistics/geography/policy/coding-and-naming-for-statistical-geographies/chd-look-ups/administrative-geography/government-office-regions--england-.zip

Current code  Former code  Geography name
============  ===========  =========================
E12000001               A  North East
E12000002               B  North West
E12000003               D  Yorkshire and The Humber
E12000004               E  East Midlands
E12000005               F  West Midlands
E12000006               G  East of England
E12000007               H  London
E12000008               J  South East
E12000009               K  South West


There are also the pseudo-codes which are referred to in the
  ONSPD User Guide and Version Notes
  (
http://www.ons.gov.uk/about-statistics/geography/products/geog-products-postcode/nspd/nspd-user-guide-and-version-notes.zip
)
referred to on this page:

http://www.ons.gov.uk/about-statistics/geography/products/geog-products-postcode/nspd/index.html
In short, the other codes are:
  W99999999 (pseudo) = Wales;
  S99999999 (pseudo) = Scotland;
  N99999999 (pseudo) = Northern Ireland;
  L99999999 (pseudo) = Channel Islands;
  M99999999 (pseudo) = Isle of Man;
  null = no information available

I hope this makes sense.
Any other questions, feel free to ask.

Kieran.
